action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a wardrobe, a bed and a pillow. The wardrobe is closed. The pillow is on the bed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a broom closet here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a counter and a plate. The cupboard is closed. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a living room, a pantry and a hallway here.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.
You are in a living room now. There are a table, a book, a shelf, a couch, a chair and a side table. The book is on the side table. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You take the book. In your inventory you have a plate and a book.
You put the book on the table.
You put the plate on the table.
You can't go to a hallway from here.
I don't know what you mean.
You can't go to a hallway from here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room, a pantry and a hallway here.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a broom closet here.
You are in a broom closet now. There are a broom and a mop. The broom is on the floor. The mop is on the floor. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The mop is already in your inventory.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a kitchen, a bedroom and a broom closet here.
You can't go to a living room from here.
> go to kitchen to living room
I don't know what you mean.
> go to kitchen then go to living room
I don't know what you mean.

> go to kitchen
> go to living room
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard and a counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a living room, a pantry and a hallway here.

You are in a living room now. There are a table, a book, a shelf, a plate, a couch, a chair and a side table. The book is on the table. The plate is on the table. There is a passage to a kitchen here.
You can't see a mop here.
> take mop from inventory and put on table
I don't know what you mean.
> place mop from inventory onto table
I don't know how to interpret this 'place' action.
> use mop from inventory and put it on table
I don't know how to interpret this 'use' action.

> inventory
> take mop from inventory
> put mop on table
I don't know how to interpret this 'inventory' action.

> drop mop
> pick up mop
> go to living room
> put mop on table
I don't know how to interpret this 'drop' action.

> examine inventory
> select mop
> go to living room
> place mop on table
You can't see a inventory here.
Model produced DONE action at turn 28, end episode.
